[meredith_grey] wakes up from the couch. [meredith_grey] wraps a towel around herself and starts picking up her clothes. [meredith_grey] throws a cushion at a man. [derek_shepherd] wakes up sleepily and hands [meredith_grey] her bra. [meredith_grey] feels embarrassed and tells [derek_shepherd] to get dressed. They chat while [derek_shepherd] dresses. [meredith_grey] mentions she will be late for her first day at a new job. [derek_shepherd] compliments [meredith_grey]'s house. [meredith_grey] says it isn't hers; it was her mother's, and she is selling it. [derek_shepherd] apologizes, thinking [meredith_grey]'s mother is dead. [meredith_grey] quickly clarifies her mother is not dead. [meredith_grey] says they don't need to pretend to care. [meredith_grey] goes to see [derek_shepherd] off but forgets his name. [derek_shepherd] introduces himself as [derek_shepherd]. [meredith_grey] introduces herself as [meredith_grey]. [meredith_grey] runs upstairs to shower.

Later, [meredith_grey] leaves her car. [meredith_grey] joins the new interns at Seattle Grace Hospital. The Chief finishes the tour. The Chief says the next seven years will be the best and worst of the interns' lives. In the locker room, [meredith_grey] bonds with [cristina_yang]. [meredith_grey] and [cristina_yang] find out they have the same resident, [miranda_bailey], also known as "The Nazi." [george_omalley], another intern, overhears and introduces himself. [george_omalley] talks nervously and tells [meredith_grey] they met last night. [george_omalley] describes [meredith_grey]'s outfit but stops when [meredith_grey] and [cristina_yang] think he's gay.

The three interns, along with [isobel_stevens], are called to see [miranda_bailey]. They approach [miranda_bailey] and are surprised she's a woman and not a Nazi. [isobel_stevens] thinks the nickname might be due to jealousy. [cristina_yang] dismisses this, but [isobel_stevens] introduces herself as [isobel_stevens], saying everyone calls her [isobel_stevens]. [miranda_bailey] ignores the introduction, shows the interns their equipment, gives a short tour, and explains her rules.
[miranda_bailey] gets a page, and she and the interns rush to the roof. A helicopter lands on the roof with details about a patient, [katie_bryce], who is having seizures.

In the hospital, the interns and nurses inject [katie_bryce], and [katie_bryce] stops moving. [preston_burke] enters and compares [katie_bryce] to a wet fish on dry land. [preston_burke] orders basic tests. [george_omalley] is assigned workups, [cristina_yang] is to do labs, and [meredith_grey] is assigned to [katie_bryce] and to get her a CT scan. [miranda_bailey] tells [isobel_stevens] to perform rectal exams with a smile.

[isobel_stevens] does the rectal exams. [cristina_yang] gets the test results and hints to [miranda_bailey] about wanting a surgery. [george_omalley] tries a simple procedure on a patient. [preston_burke] gets frustrated and takes over. [george_omalley] jokes that [preston_burke] probably messed up a lot at first too. [preston_burke] smiles tightly and tells [george_omalley] he'll have fun with him. [george_omalley] gulps.

[meredith_grey] is lost in the hospital with [katie_bryce]. [katie_bryce] talks about missing a beauty pageant and how she was great except for falling during rhythmic gymnastics. [katie_bryce] occasionally tells [meredith_grey] she is lost.

A group of interns sit in the canteen after 7 hours of their first shift. [isobel_stevens] says a resident already hates her. [george_omalley] sympathizes, saying attendings hate him too. [cristina_yang] asks if anyone knew [meredith_grey]'s mother is [ellis_grey], a famous surgeon who won the Harper Avery Award twice. [meredith_grey] quickly says [katie_bryce] is unbearable.
[preston_burke] arrives at the table. [preston_burke] says he can choose one intern to assist in a surgery. [preston_burke] picks [george_omalley] for an appendectomy and walks away.

[miranda_bailey] complains to [preston_burke] about his decision. [miranda_bailey] says [george_omalley] barely made it into the program. [preston_burke] insists that if he pressures [george_omalley], the rest will follow. [miranda_bailey] tries to persuade [preston_burke] otherwise.

[katie_bryce]'s parents enter [katie_bryce]'s room. [katie_bryce]'s parents check if [katie_bryce] feels okay. [katie_bryce]'s parents ask [meredith_grey] if [katie_bryce] might need surgery. [meredith_grey] explains she isn't the doctor.

[meredith_grey] goes to [miranda_bailey] to find [preston_burke]. [preston_burke] is off the case, so [miranda_bailey] directs [meredith_grey] to [derek_shepherd]. [meredith_grey] looks at [derek_shepherd] as [derek_shepherd] looks up. [meredith_grey] quickly walks away because [derek_shepherd] is her one-night stand, [derek_shepherd].

[derek_shepherd] catches up with [meredith_grey] and pulls her into a stairwell. [meredith_grey] decides to pretend it never happened. [derek_shepherd] says [meredith_grey] took advantage of him. [meredith_grey] starts to disagree. [derek_shepherd] quickly asks if [meredith_grey] wants to take advantage of him next Friday. [meredith_grey] smiles, says it's inappropriate, and walks away.

[george_omalley] is in the operating room. In the gallery, other interns bet against [george_omalley]. [meredith_grey] defends [george_omalley]. [george_omalley] starts the procedure well. At the end, [george_omalley] pulls the purse strings too hard and breaks them. The patient starts to bleed. [george_omalley] can't think of what to do. [preston_burke] pushes [george_omalley] aside and finishes the procedure. The interns nickname [george_omalley] "007" in the gallery.

Afterward, [george_omalley] worries about the nickname. [meredith_grey] is paged and leaves for [katie_bryce]. [george_omalley] says he should have gone into geriatrics. [cristina_yang] says geriatrics is for losers who never have sex and live with their mothers. [george_omalley] quietly tells [isobel_stevens] he needs a new place.
[meredith_grey] runs through the hospital. [meredith_grey] finds [katie_bryce], who faked a seizure and wants [meredith_grey] to call someone. Annoyed, [meredith_grey] leaves.

Nurse [nurse_tyler] asks [isobel_stevens] what [isobel_stevens] needs. [isobel_stevens] says [mr_jones] has bad veins and needs antibiotics. [isobel_stevens] should start a central line but doesn't know how. Nurse [nurse_tyler] smiles and tells [isobel_stevens] to wake up [miranda_bailey], the on-call resident. [isobel_stevens] timidly walks over.

[miranda_bailey] asks if the patient is dying. When [isobel_stevens] says no, [miranda_bailey] goes back to sleep. After a few seconds, [miranda_bailey] gets up grumpily and starts the central line. [miranda_bailey] tells [isobel_stevens] that next time [miranda_bailey] is woken up, the patient better be near death.

[alex_karev] looks at a patient's chart. [alex_karev] tells the nurse they have pneumonia and to start antibiotics. The nurse asks if [alex_karev] is sure. [alex_karev] sarcastically asks if the nurse went through four years of medical school. [alex_karev] walks over to [meredith_grey]. [alex_karev] says he has [jeremy_resident] as his resident. [meredith_grey] replies that the patient might not have pneumonia; it could be splinting. [alex_karev] calls [meredith_grey] a nurse. [meredith_grey] feels insulted but answers her page. It's another 911 from [katie_bryce].
[alex_karev] asks another intern if [meredith_grey] is single. [george_omalley] says they are friends. [alex_karev] tells [george_omalley] to stop talking.

[meredith_grey] rushes to [katie_bryce]'s room. [meredith_grey] is shocked to see [katie_bryce] having severe seizures. The drugs didn't work. [meredith_grey] tells a nurse to page [miranda_bailey] and [derek_shepherd]. The drugs still don't work, so [meredith_grey] charges the paddles. On the fourth try, [katie_bryce]'s heartbeat and blood flow return to normal.

[derek_shepherd] arrives and tells [meredith_grey] to leave. [miranda_bailey] walks by and lectures [meredith_grey]. [meredith_grey] ignores [miranda_bailey] and walks quickly out of the hospital. [cristina_yang] follows [meredith_grey] and sees [meredith_grey] throw up against a tree. [meredith_grey] returns to the hospital and tells [cristina_yang] to keep it a secret.

Inside the hospital, [derek_shepherd] talks to [katie_bryce]'s parents. [derek_shepherd] says it might not be a seizure disorder. [katie_bryce]'s parents want another doctor because they feel [derek_shepherd] isn't trying hard enough.

In another part of the hospital, [preston_burke] explains a procedure to a patient named [tony_savitch]. [preston_burke] will put [tony_savitch] on bypass, fix [tony_savitch]'s heart, and finish. [gloria_savitch], [tony_savitch]'s wife, asks if she should worry. [preston_burke] assures [gloria_savitch] he is skilled, but reminds [gloria_savitch] that surgery has risks. [preston_burke] leaves, but [gloria_savitch] is still worried. [george_omalley] comforts [gloria_savitch] and promises [tony_savitch] will do well in surgery.

[cristina_yang] waits for [derek_shepherd] and sutures a banana. [cristina_yang] calls [george_omalley] "007" when [george_omalley] laughs but quickly apologizes, saying [cristina_yang] gets mean when tired. [derek_shepherd] enters and says [katie_bryce] is having seizures without a clear cause. [derek_shepherd] calls [katie_bryce] a ticking clock. The intern who discovers the cause will assist in the advanced surgery. All the interns take copies of [katie_bryce]'s chart.

[alex_karev] approaches a nurse. The nurse confirms she paged [alex_karev] because the patient in 4B isn't responding to antibiotics. [alex_karev] dismisses it, saying the patient is old, and asks not to be paged again.

[meredith_grey] walks away. [cristina_yang] catches up and suggests they work together for a better chance at the surgery. [meredith_grey] agrees but says [meredith_grey] doesn't want the surgery to avoid spending time with [derek_shepherd].

In the hospital library, [cristina_yang] and [meredith_grey] try to diagnose [katie_bryce]. [cristina_yang] asks why [meredith_grey] avoids [derek_shepherd]. [meredith_grey] admits she had sex with [derek_shepherd]. They return to discussing [katie_bryce] when [meredith_grey] realizes something. [meredith_grey] tells [cristina_yang] to find [derek_shepherd].

[cristina_yang] and [meredith_grey] confront [derek_shepherd] and tell him they suspect [katie_bryce] has an aneurysm, even without proof. [katie_bryce] had a minor fall, but [katie_bryce]'s doctor didn't mention it. [derek_shepherd] checks and is shocked to find [cristina_yang] and [meredith_grey] were right. [katie_bryce] is bleeding into her brain. [derek_shepherd] says [katie_bryce] might have lived her whole life without it being a problem. [derek_shepherd] congratulates [cristina_yang] and [meredith_grey] and chooses [meredith_grey] to join him in the O.R.
After [derek_shepherd] leaves, [cristina_yang] glares at [meredith_grey] and storms off.

Meanwhile, [preston_burke] operates on [tony_savitch]. After a while, [preston_burke] goes to [george_omalley]. [george_omalley] is shocked at [preston_burke]'s speed. [preston_burke] explains the heart was too damaged and [tony_savitch] died. [george_omalley] is upset and tells [preston_burke] he promised [gloria_savitch] that [tony_savitch] would be okay. [preston_burke] is angry. [preston_burke] says only God can keep such a promise. [preston_burke] tells [george_omalley] to inform [gloria_savitch].

[isobel_stevens] and [cristina_yang] are sitting privately. [isobel_stevens] suggests it might not be [meredith_grey]'s fault. [cristina_yang] interrupts [isobel_stevens]. [meredith_grey] arrives and tries to apologize. [cristina_yang] says [meredith_grey] can't seek forgiveness from her. [cristina_yang] adds that at least [meredith_grey] didn't get into med school because of her mother or good surgeries by sleeping with her boss. [meredith_grey] leaves upset.

[george_omalley] is in the waiting area. [george_omalley] tries to tell [gloria_savitch] that [tony_savitch] died. [george_omalley] apologizes, but [gloria_savitch] asks him to leave and collapses into a chair.

[derek_shepherd] is shaving [katie_bryce]'s head. [meredith_grey] says she doesn't want to assist, but [derek_shepherd] insists. [derek_shepherd] explains his decision wasn't because they had sex, but because [meredith_grey] was [katie_bryce]'s doctor and helped save her life on her first day.

[meredith_grey] and [george_omalley] sit on a window ledge outside. [meredith_grey] and [george_omalley] wish they had chosen different careers. [george_omalley] mentions his parents brag about him being a surgeon. [meredith_grey] shares that [ellis_grey] tried to discourage her from medical school, doubting [meredith_grey]'s abilities, so [george_omalley] shouldn't feel bad.

[richard_webber] asks [alex_karev] some questions. [alex_karev] doesn't reply. [richard_webber] asks if anyone knows the common causes of post-op fever. Nobody answers. [meredith_grey] answers. [richard_webber] asks [meredith_grey] what she thinks is wrong with the patient. [meredith_grey] says patient 4B might have a pulmonary embolism. [richard_webber] asks how [meredith_grey] would diagnose it. [meredith_grey] answers correctly. [richard_webber] tells [alex_karev] to follow [meredith_grey]'s advice and removes [alex_karev] from the case. As [richard_webber] walks away, he tells [meredith_grey] he recognizes her and she looks like [ellis_grey].

[meredith_grey] goes to the O.R. where [katie_bryce] is being prepped. [meredith_grey] watches with admiration. [derek_shepherd] tells [meredith_grey] to take a look. [meredith_grey] looks and is amazed. [meredith_grey] realizes it's more than a game. [meredith_grey] and [cristina_yang] have lives in their hands.

Outside the operating room, after the surgery, [cristina_yang] compliments [meredith_grey]. A few minutes later, [meredith_grey] and [cristina_yang] make up. [cristina_yang] leaves, and [derek_shepherd] arrives. [meredith_grey] tells [derek_shepherd] the surgery was amazing and more exciting than she expected. [meredith_grey] and [derek_shepherd] share a moment, and [derek_shepherd] says he'll see [meredith_grey] around, then leaves.
[meredith_grey] later leaves the hospital with [cristina_yang], [isobel_stevens], and [george_omalley].

Later, [meredith_grey] walks up the steps of a house in the rain. [meredith_grey] tells [ellis_grey] she won't sell her house and plans to get roommates. [meredith_grey] mentions her fellow interns are great. [ellis_grey] asks if [meredith_grey] is her doctor. [meredith_grey] says no, but she is a doctor. [ellis_grey] asks [meredith_grey]'s name, and [meredith_grey] reminds her. [ellis_grey] says she thinks she used to be a doctor. [meredith_grey] smiles and confirms [ellis_grey] was a doctor. [ellis_grey] has Alzheimer's disease.
